36 """
37 Writes a test failure out to test file if it doesn't exist.
38 """
39 
40 from __future__ import print_function
41 
42 import os
43 import sys
44 
45 import rospkg
46 
47 import rosunit
48 
49 NAME = 'check_test_ran.py'
50 
51 
52 def usage():
53  print("""Usage:
54 \t%s test-file.xml
55 or
56 \t%s --rostest pkg-name test-file.xml
57 """ % (NAME, NAME), file=sys.stderr)
58  print(sys.argv)
59  sys.exit(getattr(os, 'EX_USAGE', 1))
60 
61 
62 def check_main():
63  if len(sys.argv) < 2:
64  usage()
65  if '--rostest' in sys.argv[1:]:
66  if len(sys.argv) != 4:
67  usage()
68  test_pkg, test_file = [a for a in sys.argv[1:] if a != '--rostest']
69  # this logic derives the output filename that rostest uses
70 
71  r = rospkg.RosPack()
72  pkg_name = rospkg.get_package_name(test_file)
73  pkg_dir = r.get_path(pkg_name)
74 
75  # compute test name for friendlier reporting
76  outname = rosunit.rostest_name_from_path(pkg_dir, test_file)
77 
78  test_file = rosunit.xml_results_file(test_pkg, outname, is_rostest=True)
79  else:
80  if len(sys.argv) != 2:
81  usage()
82  test_file = sys.argv[1]
83 
84  print('Checking for test results in %s' % test_file)
85 
86  if not os.path.exists(test_file):
87  if not os.path.exists(os.path.dirname(test_file)):
88  os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(test_file))
89 
90  print('Cannot find results, writing failure results to', test_file)
91 
92  with open(test_file, 'w') as f:
93  test_name = os.path.basename(test_file)
94  d = {'test': test_name, 'test_file': test_file}
95  f.write("""<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
96 <testsuite tests="1" failures="1" time="1" errors="0" name="%(test)s">
97  <testcase name="test_ran" status="run" time="1" classname="Results">
98  <failure message="Unable to find test results for %(test)s, test did not run.\nExpected results in %(test_file)s" type=""/>
99  </testcase>
100 </testsuite>""" % d)
101 
102 
103 if __name__ == '__main__':
104  check_main()

def usage()

def check_main()
